column1: #Text=Wikinews interviews Dr Clive Hamilton about the upcoming by-election in the Higgins electorate of the Australian parliament
#Text=With two by-elections coming up in Australia , many minor parties and independents will be looking to gain a seat in the House of Representatives .
#Text=is one of the independents / candidate for the Australian Greens .
#Text=Dr Hamilton was awarded Member of the Order of Australia honours for his contributions to public debate and public policy earlier this year .
#Text=Wikinews reporter Patrick Gillett held an exclusive email interview with Dr Hamilton , candidate for the Division of Higgins .
#Text=In participating in this interview , Dr Hamilton was about to fly out to a function .
#Text=Why do you want to get into parliament ?
#Text=The main reason for standing as the Greens candidate for Higgins is that I am extremely worried about climate change .
#Text=The future of our children is at stake yet the main political parties seem more interested in appeasing the fossil fuel lobby .
#Text=The Greens policy on climate change is the only one that is based on what the climate scientists are convinced we need to do .
#Text=What would the three main policies you are taking into this by-election be ?
#Text=Climate change policy , asylum seekers and work-life balance .
#Text=The Greens have strong policies in these areas .
#Text=Sending asylum seekers to Indonesia : good or bad ?
#Text=We have a legal and moral obligation to land asylum seekers in Australia if they are found in Australian waters , then to quickly assess their claims .
#Text=Sending them to Indonesian camps is inhumane , as anyone who knows anything about Indonesian prisons will testify .
#Text=Is the Australian dollar 's near parrity with the US dollar a sign that the Australian economy is healthy , the US economy in chaos or both ?
